comment: Bird's opening. White plays for control of e5 and a kingside attack.
White plans to position his bishops on b2 and d3.
To develop the bishop and castle.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3
comment: It is unusual to block the d pawn. The move works out well in this position, however.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6
comment: Black would probably have been better off castling followed by ... c5 and ... Nc6

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3
comment: The knight is not particularly effective here, but it will move to e2, g3 and eventually h5.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3
comment: Attacking the key square e5.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2
comment: Repositioning the knight and unleashing the bishop on b2.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7
comment: Planning 12... c4 chasing the bishop from its powerful position.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7 11. Ne5 Nxe5 12. Bxe5 Qc6
comment: Indirectly threatening the square g2 and once again threatening c4.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7 11. Ne5 Nxe5 12. Bxe5 Qc6 13. Qe2
comment: Preventing 13... c4. If 13... Rac8 then 14. Bb5 trapping the queen.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7 11. Ne5 Nxe5 12. Bxe5 Qc6 13. Qe2 a6
comment: Preventing 14. Bb5.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7 11. Ne5 Nxe5 12. Bxe5 Qc6 13. Qe2 a6 14. Nh5
comment: Threatening 15. Nxf6+ Bxf6 16. Bxf6 gxf6 17. Bxh7+ Kxh7 18. Qh5+ Kg7 19. Qg4+ Kh2 20. Rf3 and 21. Rh3 Mate cannot be prevented.

moves: 1. f4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. b3 e6 4. Bb2 Be7 5. Bd3 b6 6. Nc3 Bb7 7. Nf3 Nbd7 8. O-O O-O 9. Ne2 c5 10. Ng3 Qc7 11. Ne5 Nxe5 12. Bxe5 Qc6 13. Qe2 a6 14. Nh5 Nxh5
comment: Black undoubtedly expected 15. Qxh5 f5 where White has a powerful attack, but the game still has a lot of play in it.
